newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Chase to buy into new stockbroking firm.
newsitem.headline: Chase to buy into new stockbroking firm.

text.p: Malaysian construction firm Chase Perdana Bhd said it has signed an agreement to buy a 51 percent stake in a company which is a key shareholder in a new stockbroking firm.
Chase said in a statement that it will pay 22 million ringgit for a 51 percent equity in Jernih Karya Sdn Bhd, which in turn holds a 49 percent stake in Dioncorp Sdn Bhd.
Dioncorp is the holding company of wholly-owned First Securities Sdn Bhd, a new stockbroking firm to be set up in Malaysia's Borneo state of Sabah.
The Ministry of Finance on June 18 approved the setting of the stockbroking firm in the Sabah town of Tawau, the statement said.
Jernih Karya will hold a 49 percent equity in the stockbroking firm and Yayasan Bumiputra Sabah the remaining 51 percent.
Chase Perdana asked the Kuala Lumpur Stock Exchange to lift the suspension of its shares from Monday. Chase Perdana shares were last traded on June 9 at 22.0 ringgit.
